thread.title: ‘A Ciambra’ Review: Stealing Our Hearts

author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘A Ciambra’ Review: Stealing Our Hearts
text:
If you choose to view “A Ciambra” uncharitably, you may see it as a movie with a documentary flavor about a raffish Romani family in southern Italy and a kid who’s learning to steal everything in sight. I’d urge another choice, and I don’t think I’m being charitable. Jonas Carpignano’s second feature—and Italy’s entry for this year’s foreign-language Oscar—is shockingly alive, startlingly accomplished and remarkably acute. It’s a neo-realist study of a kid with special gifts for leadership, daring and friendship. And for stealing everything in sight.
